Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producerâ€™s Club Sponsorship â€˜Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatreâ€™s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatreâ€™s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Poâ€˜okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival in Clearwater Beach - Tips and Advice Skip to content Go to... BLOG HOME ST PETE REAL ESTATE INFO CONTACT ST PETE REALTOR ABOUT MIKE + TEAM Real Estate Advice for St Pete & Beaches? Call or Text Realtor Mike Braswell @ 727-510-1084 @LovingStPete is Followed by 95K+ Need Real Estate Advice for St Pete & Beaches? Call/Text Mike! 727-510-1084 Toggle Navigation BLOG HOME ST PETE REAL ESTATE INFO CONTACT ST PETE REALTOR ABOUT MIKE + TEAM Beach Life , Clearwater and North Pinellas , Festivals , Kids Activity Ideas Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Tips and Advice â€“ Clearwater Beach By St Petersburg Realtor, Mike Braswell Published On: April 17th, 2023 Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Tips and Advice â€“ Clearwater Beach P ublished on 04/17/23: Tips and feedback on the Sugar Sand Festival at Pier 60 in Clearwater Beach. We were first time visitors to this annual event, though I suspected my family would enjoy, as they had fun at Treasure Islandâ€™s Sanding Ovations. Turns out it was a hit, with a couple lessons learned in the process! Event runs until April 23rd. Visit Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival on the Weekday We visited on the weekend. Traffic was â€œliterally crazyâ€ in the words of my 7 year old, who currently prefixes most statements with â€œliterallyâ€. ðŸ¤·ðŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸ If you can visit during the week, do that instead. Ride the free Park and Ride on the Weekend If you visit on the weekend, ride the free Park and Ride. It drops you off and picks up right outside the festival! No need to find a parking spot. Afterwards, as we sat on the cold bus (â€œliterally freezingâ€ per Colt), I told my wife this was one of my better recent decisions. You still sit in traffic, but I canâ€™t even imagine trying to find parking in Clearwater Beach. It was bumper to bumper from 2 miles out. Decades Theme for Sand Sculptures is Great The â€œDecades, Blast from the pastâ€ theme of the sculpture festival was great. I especially enjoyed seeing my childhood represented with for instance E.T., Home Alone, Slash, Run DMC, Slash, Mario Brothers, Simpsons, Ghostbusters, MTV, The NeverEnding Story, and many more just in those couple decades alone. A trip down memory lane! The Sand Sculpture Festival Costs Money, but Worth It You need to pay $14 to see the sculptures. Ages 3 and under are free. The huge 21K sqft tent offered many more sculptures than another local sand sculpture festival, and includes themed music and lighting for the decades. Looks like it took someone a lot of work, plus proceeds benefit local charities per organizers. And you know what, some days, Iâ€™d simply pay for shade on the beach.Â ðŸ˜…. Btw, thatâ€™s where Beachfront Bellhop comes inâ€¦ Bring Towel or Seating, plus Sunblock Bring a towel or blanket and sunblock. Something to sit on didnâ€™t cross our mind, but inevitably youâ€™re going to end up on the beach itself. Especially if near sunset or you have children. The sculptures inspired Colt to want to build his own, so we ended up digging on the beach in our regular clothes, throwing a curveball to those playing â€œspot the touristâ€. If you can, try to time your visit with the amazing daily sunset. Two birds, one trip. Wear Easy to Remove Shoes Wear shoes that are easy to remove. The sculptures are not built around sidewalks, youâ€™re walking thru sand as you roam.Â ðŸ°Â Much easier to walk barefoot in sand than with shoes. Figure Youâ€™ll Stay in Clearwater Beach for a While Donâ€™t plan to just look at the sculptures and leave. Itâ€™s not going to happen. Thereâ€™s much to do, even if you donâ€™t buy a ticket to visit the actual sand sculpture tent. Sit on the beach, walk the pier, check out the street artists, grab food and drink from one of the many vendors (street corn!), and might as well check out nearby bar/restaurants just a few steps away. I mean, as long as you already have parking (or park and ride) why not. We ended up making an afternoon of it and arrived home well after dark. Hope you enjoy! Ticket link: https://www.sugarsandfestival.com/p/tickets Post brought to you by the LovingStPete Team. Youâ€™ll receive up to $10K at closing when you buy or sell a property with my team. Iâ€™m a Clearwater Beach Realtor who runs the LovingStPete Guide on social media. Over 28K people follow my guide for activity suggestions and other information about our area! Youâ€™ll receive up to $10K at closing when you use my LovingStPete Team to buy or sell a property! Simply contact me . if youâ€™re interested in buying or selling in the Tampa Bay Area. I love our industry and even founded a vacation rental business and ran for a decade, before HomeAway/VRBO acquired. As a Florida native and St. Pete resident, I would love to earn your real estate business ! Share this article Written by : St Petersburg Realtor, Mike Braswell Mike Braswell is a St Petersburg Realtor, serving St Pete, Clearwater, all nearby beaches and more. He's part of the LovingStPete Team at Keller Williams. Mike, Leah, and Ryan are the trusted real estate team in our area. Mike's Cell: 727-510-1084 Email: [emailÂ protected] Mike founded a property advertising business and operated for 10+ years as CEO/Owner, eventually acquired by VRBO. Mike enjoys boating and is an avid tennis player. Mike grew up on an avocado farm with 15+ varieties, some of which you can find in our local Publix/Winn Dixie as his dad still farms the same farm at 88 years old! By: Frances Lin Posted and last updated CLEARWATER BEACH, Fla. â€” The highly anticipated Sugar Sand Festival is set to enchant visitors once again as it returns to Clearwater Beach this weekend. The festival promises exciting new artists and vibrant attractions for all ages. Photojournalist Brad Davis spent the day at the festival to â€œMeet the Mastersâ€ and capture the buzz as they began to dig into their art. Lisa Chandler , founder of the Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival, shared her excitement for this yearâ€™s event. " This year's exhibit is very three-dimensional. It's the largest sculptor that we've ever sculpted in 11 years. We commissioned Tampa Bay Sand Sculpting Company to sculpt the exhibit, and each sculptor is invited based upon their skill set. We have 17 master sculptors this year on the pile.â€ The Sugar Sand Festival will include a lineup of events such as free beach concerts, street performances, and the iconic Ferris wheel. Attendees will also have the chance to witness the incredible sand sculptures coming to life throughout the festivities. The Sugar Sand Festival runs from April 11 to 27 on Clearwater Beach. More information on the festival can be found at this link People across the Tampa Bay-area remember 9/11 on the 24th anniversary In Hillsborough County, the community is coming together to ensure that the memory of 9/11 endures for future generations. The big Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival returns to Clearwater Beach this spring We use cookies to give you the best experience on our site. Learn more or close to accept. Ã— Skip to content Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Search Search COMMUNITY PARTNER Beyond the Burg The big Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival returns to Clearwater Beach this spring April 8, 2025 â€¢ By Andrew Harlan Photo via Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival April 8, 2025 â€¢ By Andrew Harlan 49 SHARES Facebook Twitter The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival is a mustâ€‘see Florida event that celebrates art, community, and the natural beauty of Clearwater Beach . This year, it will be held at 1 Causeway Blvd. from April 11 to 27. The Sugar Sand Walk Exhibit has expanded to 24,000 square feet, showcasing even more incredible sand sculptures. The best part? An augmented reality experience brings these masterpieces to life, offering a new way to appreciate the art. ADVERTISEMENT Marvel at larger than life sand sculpture | Photo via Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival 17 professional sand sculptors arrive in Clearwater Beach Presented by Visit St. Pete-Clearwater , the festival highlights the work of 17 professional sand sculptors from around the world. These talented artists transform the famous sugar sand into stunning sculptures that are sure to leave you in awe. But the fun doesnâ€™t stop there. The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival offers much more than sand art. Enjoy free sand sculpting classes, live music, fireworks, and an array of food vendors and artisans. Pier 60 Park also features a Ferris wheel and other amusements for extra thrillsâ€”nothing beats a sunset view from the top of the Ferris wheel. Photo via Sunsets at Pier 60 Giant dinosaurs and lovely Ferris wheel views This yearâ€™s theme, â€œDinoshores: Prehistoric Adventure in Sand,â€ will transport you back to a world of giant sand dinosaurs. The expanded exhibit will feature jawâ€‘dropping sculptures that bring these ancient creatures to life. Thanks to augmented reality and projection mapping, you can watch the dinosaurs stomp, roar, and move right before your eyes. Tickets are available now online. Sugar Sand Walk Exhibit Hours: Sunday â€“ Thursday: 10:00 a.m. â€“ 9:00 p.m. (Complimentary Souvenir Photo Opportunity closes at 8:00 p.m.) Friday & Saturday: 10:00 a.m. â€“ 10:00 p.m. (Complimentary Souvenir Photo Opportunity closes at 9:00 p.m.) *Easter Sunday: 10 a.m. â€“ 9:00 p.m. (Complimentary Souvenir Photo Opportunity closes at 6:30 p.m.) In addition to marveling at magnificent sand sculptures, attendees and Clearwater Beach visitors can also enjoy Frenchyâ€™s Free Beach concerts, salsa and bachata dancing on Pier 60, and free beach yoga. For a full schedule of events, check out the festivalâ€™s Facebook page . OUR TEAM | CAMP top of page Home ABOUT OUR TEAM JOIN THE TEAM PROGRAMS TACT URBAN ARTS NORTHERN LIGHTS BLUEGRASS MUSIC CAMP GIRLS ROCK THE NORTH YOUTH MUSIC CAMPS RESIDENCIES CULTURAL FOUNDATIONS MUSIC IN SCHOOLS ARTS EXPLORATION TOUR SOA FIDDLE MENTORSHIP CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT HIP HOP COLLABORATION MUSIC TEACHER MENTORSHIP CONTACT NEWS DOYLEFEST LINEUP AND TICKETS ABOUT GET INVOLVED GALLERY CONTACT PAST PERFORMERS DONATE Our Team. Rooted in the arts. Experts in various fields, working together to share their talents in communities across Saskatchewan. Eliza Doyle managingdirector@communityartsmentorship.com Co - Founder / Managing Director Eliza is a professional musician, songwriter and recording artist, teacher, community advocate, leader and is the co-founder behind Saskatchewanâ€™s arts organization, C.A.M.P; Community Arts Mentorship Program. Her focus on fostering the arts while supporting local community capacity to deliver arts programming has been welcomed throughout communities in Saskatchewan. Offering services to remote and under-served communities presents new challenges, and all of CAMP programming serves to mitigate these obstacles. Familiar with the arts and music industry in Saskatchewan, she also aims to provide the opportunity and mentorship available to people with challenges in access due to location and lack of resources. Holly Rae Yuzicapi culturalengagement@communityartsmentorship.com Co - Founder / Cultural Consultant The co-founder of CAMP and a proud Dakota/Lakota from the Standing Buffalo Dakota Nation in Treaty 4 Territory, Saskatchewan.Â  Holly grew up in the beautiful Qu'Appelle valley.Â  Coming from a large family, Holly has been able to observe and learn from many generations of the Goodwill and Yuzicapi families.Â  The strength of her sense of identity was nurtured and shaped by her family and community.Â  Without realizing it at the time, Holly started doing cultural arts sharing from a young age which really is rooted in participating in powwow dancing and attending other cultural events on a regular basis.Â  She has evolved into an independent natural materials artist that loves to facilitate cultural arts engagement opportunities to all audiences.Â  Holly is proud of how she was raised and is very thankful for all that her family has taught her.Â  Respectfully representing the spirit and potential of those teachings is why Holly does the work that she does.Â  It is how she chooses to honour her family. LJ Tyson Kimbley innovationliaison@communityartsmentorship.com Innovation Liaison LJ Tyson is a singer-songwriter from Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. The has used his identity as inspiration for creating lyrics and melodies. LJ has had music played across Canada and beyond. His latest release Home On A Rainbow was critically acclaimed and awarded a prize from SOCAN TD Indigenous Songwriter Awards. LJ currently works as Innovation Liaison for Community Arts mentorship program, bringing music to remote and underserved communities. Steph Cameron administrativedirector@communityartsmentorship.com Administrative Director Saskatchewan-based artist Steph Cameron has gained recognition for her unique take on contemporary Americana music, lively instrumentation, and captivating lyrics. From her early days of busking, she has become an internationally touring professional recording artist. Her critically acclaimed debut album, Sad-Eyed Lonesome Lady, released on Pheromone Recordings in 2014, was nominated for the Polaris Music Prize and praised as the #1 Canadian album of that year by PopMatters, while No Depression called it "a stunning debut." This success led her to join the Paquin Artist Agency and embark on national tours. Her expertise in performing is the real world experience CAMP participants benefit the most from . Zoe Slusar programcoordinator@communityartsmentorship.com Program Coordinator Zoe Slusar was the voice actress for Kid Goku in the English dubs of the Dragon Ball and Dragon Ball GT anime, done by Blue Water Studios. She also provided the voice of Sai Saici in Kidou Butouden G Gundam, as well as the video game Gundam: Battle Assault 2.

Zoe also voiced the character Jungo in the Flemish created series.

Zoe, also known by her stage name ZHE the Free, released her first rap EP album titled The Love EP in September 2020. This album charted #1 on 90.9 CJSW in Calgary, Alberta in November 2020. Mitchell Dureault programcoordinator@communityartsmentorship.com Program Coordinator Mitch Dureault is a seasoned professional music instructor and traditional musician, who comes from the Treaty 4 Territory of the southern Saskatchewan prairies. Currently sitting as a board member, and working instructor for C.A.M.P., Mitch is an advocate for the arts and has a strong focus on decolonizing his own music & teaching practices. He regularly draws from his B.A. in International Studies while working with and aiding organisations, communities, and schools in the development and implementation of equitable and continual art programming throughout the province. Mitch is also very passionate about the promotion and preservation of the local culture of Saskatchewan fiddling and has been making efforts to visit and interview as many fiddlers as possible from across the province for his Saskatchewan Fiddle History Project, a multi-year project in which he collects stories, tunes, and histories from these individuals in an attempt to preserve and document the ever evolving diverse intricacies of the provinces fiddling culture. Jille Shotton communications@communityartsmentorship.com sponsorship@communityartsmentorship.comâ€‹ Marketing and Communications Director\ Sponsorship Jille Shotton joined the Community Arts Mentorship Program in 2024 as the Marketing and Communications Director, bringing a decade of experience in festival marketing, promotions, and community building within Saskatchewan's arts and culture sector. Her background includes managing marketing, communications, sponsorship, and onsite operations for events such as the Northern Lights Bluegrass & Old Time Music Festival, Winterruption, Ness Creek Music Festival, Fiddlyness, Shivering Strings and the Children's Festival of Saskatchewan. Jille is passionate about strengthening communities through the arts, having organized open jams, Bluegrass Brunch, radio shows, and various events and festivals. Her work focuses on creating inclusive, vibrant spaces where the community can connect and thrive. Lillanohna Naytowhowcon President LILI, an Indigenous singer, songwriter, and recording artist hailing from Sturgeon Lake First Nation in Saskatchewan, blends her passion for music and independent songwriting. She is actively engaged in community projects that celebrate and honour Indigenous culture through a fusion of traditional Cree songs, indie rock, folk, hip-hop, and dance music.Â In 2024, expect the release of her music under the esteemed blessed-street record label, marking a significant chapter in her musical journey. The album includes collaboration with recording artist Lancelot Knight in Six Underwater, showcasing her versatility. Proudly identifying as a nehiyaw iskwew, she seamlessly weaves her creative pursuits into a traditional lifestyle, contributing to a First Nation Healing Lodge under the guidance of elders and knowledge keepers.Â The past year has been a transformative period characterized by healing and growth, with her music echoing the spirit of loss, hope, and perseverance. Her vocal style is both distinctive and heartfelt, drawing inspiration from grassroots music festivals, independent artists, and the eclectic vibes of the city. A nomadic spirit with a touch of witchy charm, LILI invites all to partake in the enchantment of her melodies. Travis Beatty Board Member Travis Beatty is from Timber Bay, Saskatchewan and is instrumentalist. He has a studio in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan called Rez Rat Recording, and is passionate about helping community and youth in Saskatchewan. He joined the CAMP Sask Arts Board of Directors in October 2023, and we are very lucky to have him! JOIN THE MAILING LIST SIGN UP NOW Thanks to our supporting organizations Email: managingdirector@communityartsmentorship.com Tel: 306-774-5888 bottom of page

Sculptors from all over the world gear up for Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival in Clearwater Beach | FOX 13 Tampa Bay News Weather Sports Good Day We Live Here Contests More Watch Live Expand / Collapse search â˜° Search site News Top Stories Local Tampa Bay News Florida Tonight National FOX 13 Investigates Consumer Health Politics Seen on TV Daily Newsletter FOX News Sunday Rhythm Roots Weather SkyTower Radar Views Interactive Radar Live Webcams Marine Weather Weather Alerts Hurricane Safety Tracking the Tropics MyFoxHurricane FOX Weather Sports Buccaneers Rays Lightning No Off Days with Scott Smith Weekly Fishing Report High School Sports Good Day Traffic Charley's World Hometown Heroes Extraordinary Ordinaries Recipes First Birthdays We Live Here What's Right Dinner DeeAs One Tank Trips Theme Parks Made in Tampa Bay Recipes, Food & Drink Tampa Bay History Care Force Watch Live How To Stream Live FOX 13 Newscasts LiveNOW from FOX FOX Weather FOX Soul FOX Live Feed Central NASA TV Money Consumer Personal Finance The Economy Small Business Entertainment Headlines Trending Stories FOX Shows What's on FOX 13 Contests Tampa Bay Reads Regional News Orlando News - FOX 35 Orlando Gainesville News - FOX 51 Gainesville Atlanta News - FOX 5 Atlanta About Us Meet the FOX 13 team TV Listings Jobs & Internships WTVT History Closed Captioning FCC Public File FCC Applications Contact Us Sculptors from all over the world gear up for Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival in Clearwater Beach By Kailey Tracy Published April 7, 2025 7:47pm EDT Clearwater FOX 13 News Share Copy Link Email Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Reddit Sugar Sand Festival on Clearwater Beach begins Friday Kailey Tracy reports. The Brief The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival starts Friday, and 17 sculptors from all over the world are in Clearwater Beach preparing now. Theyâ€™re building their creations over three weeks ahead of the festivalâ€™s 11th year. The theme this year is Dinoshores. The theme this year is Dinoshores. CLEARWATER BEACH, Fla. - The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival, presented by Visit St. Pete Clearwater, starts Friday, and 17 sculptors from all over the world are in Clearwater Beach preparing now. "Weâ€™re working with 1,000 tons of your beautiful beach sand here," sand sculptor Karen Fralich said. READ: Clearwater leaders delay vote on selling street to Church of Scientology The backstory: The sand, brought into the 24,000-square-foot exhibit straight from Clearwater Beach, acts as a symbol of how far the beach community has come. Six months ago, it seemed like the sand was everywhere but the beach. "The back-to-back hurricanes, Helene and Milton, were devastating to Clearwater Beach," Lisa Chandler, the founder of the festival, said. "We are so blessed that our city government, the City of Clearwater, was able to put Clearwater Beach back together in a remarkable amount of time, sifting the sand, cleaning the sand." "The resiliency of this beach community to come together, the importance of tourism. It is our number one economic engine for this beachâ€¦ everyone came together to bring the sand back to life," Chandler said. Follow FOX 13 on YouTube What they're saying: Now, sand sculptors are adding life to the sand in another way. Theyâ€™re building their creations over three weeks ahead of the festivalâ€™s 11th year. The theme this year is Dinoshores. "Iâ€™m addicted to sand sculpting," Fralich said. Fralich, whoâ€™s from Canada, has been sculpting sand for 31 years. This is her 10th year participating in the Sugar Sand Festival. "Here in Clearwater, you have beautiful sand. It's very, very fine, powdery and fluffy, and when you add water to it, it packs really, really easily, and you can carve it," Fralich said. "First you have to compact the sand with water. You can't just work with a soft, fluffy dry pile. It has to be compacted, and it has to be very, very wet. And that takes a lot of elbow grease, but luckily, we're all crazy. We love to shovel and pound sand and get really, really dirty, which we do. And after you compact it, then you can start carving it, and you have to start at the top and carve your way down. Otherwise, everything you carve would fall on what you've carved below." MORE: Could Pinellas County soon have a county mayor? Proposal would create new top office Dig deeper: Theyâ€™ve expanded the exhibit this year to 24,000 square feet, and added an augmented reality portion, projecting images onto the sculptures to bring them to life. "We have libraries of footage that we can put on to different types of things, and we also will go out and search for specific footage that we think or imagine might look good on here," Dave Gordon from Enlightened Monkey Arts, the company doing the augmented reality portion, said. When the festival ends, they move the sand back onto the beach. What To Know: The Festival also includes eight nights of Frenchyâ€™s free beach concerts, fireworks, free sand sculpting classes and more. You can also park for free in downtown Clearwater and hop on the Jolley Trolley that will take you to the Festival for free. Tickets are $14 plus tax and kids three and under are free. Thereâ€™s also a VIP option for $70 that includes dinner, drinks, a festival t-shirt, great seats for the concerts and entrance to the festival. It runs April 11 through April 27. The Source: The information in this story was gathered through interviews with organizers and sculptors. Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival in Clearwater Beach Skip to content Go to... BLOG HOME ST PETE REAL ESTATE INFO CONTACT ST PETE REALTOR ABOUT MIKE + TEAM Real Estate Advice for St Pete & Beaches? Call or Text Realtor Mike Braswell @ 727-510-1084 @LovingStPete is Followed by 95K+ Need Real Estate Advice for St Pete & Beaches? Call/Text Mike! 727-510-1084 Toggle Navigation BLOG HOME ST PETE REAL ESTATE INFO CONTACT ST PETE REALTOR ABOUT MIKE + TEAM Beach Life , Clearwater and North Pinellas , Festivals , Kids Activity Ideas Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival â€“ 2023 Edition By St Petersburg Realtor, Mike Braswell Published On: April 7th, 2023 The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival in Clearwater Beach P ublished on 04/07/23: Hope everyone has had a great week! We enjoyed hosting family from out of town and playing tour guide. Busy week, but love calling the Tampa Bay Area home! Anyone ready for the weekend?! [raises hand excitedly] Couple Items: Today is opening day for the 2023 Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival, presented by Visit St. Pete/Clearwater. More on that below! The theme is Decades, as the sculptors take a trip back in time. LovingStPete started a new Facebook group to give YOU a forum to share your love of our area. Actually, any beachfront or waterfront area. Post a pic of your favorite beach, sandbar, waterway, boating area, etc. Tag the area/place when possible. Weâ€™re talking beautiful water and beach views from around the world. Inspiration to those who love to explore! Hereâ€™s the URL: https://www.facebook.com/groups/boatandbeach The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Onto the Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival, an event that â€œpays tribute to Tampa Bayâ€™s two most valuable assets: our sugar sands and our sunsets!â€. For the next 17 days, Clearwater Beach transforms to a world of sand sculpting. Aspects of the festival are free, though to access the 21,000 sqft tent of sand sculptures, youâ€™ll need a ticket. The organizers mention the proceeds benefit charities around the Tampa Bay area and offset cost of the master sculptors who come from around the world. From a free perspective, youâ€™ll be able to see the fireworks (every Saturday at 9:30pm), concerts, partake in the sand sculpting classes and more. Sugar Sand Fest Ticket Cost The tentâ€™s entry cost is $14/person and free for ages 3 and under. VIP Lounge tickets are $70. Hereâ€™s the link for tickets: https://www.sugarsandfestival.com/p/tickets (all on-site ticket purchases are cashless payment options only). Note that if youâ€™re military, police officer, firefighter, teacher or healthcare worker, you can purchase $10 tickets on â€œFrontline Fridaysâ€ April 7th, April 14th and April 21st. Free Classes to Learn Sand Sculpting Upon arrival, youâ€™ll be transported to the world where the imaginations of skilled artists run wild. You can even participate in free classes to learn the skills necessary to build your own. Iâ€™m mentioning these classes near the top of the post, given the general â€œexperiencesâ€ theme of LovingStPete. The classes are daily at 2pm, except on Saturdays, when itâ€™s at 11am. Free Activities at the Sugar Sand Festival in Clearwater Beach Additionally, they offer other free activities for all ages, â€œincluding a childrenâ€™s play area, street performers, artisans, live entertainment, fireworks, sand sculpting classes, speed sand demonstrations and the master sand sculpting competitionâ€. Â Thereâ€™s also a cornhole tournament tomorrow (Saturday 4/8)! Ferris Wheel and Bounce Houses For a $7/person fee you can ride the Ferris wheel and for $3/person youâ€™ll have access to the inflatables (ie bounce houses). Thereâ€™s also $20 and $30 options for unlimited access, respectively. Give their Facebook page a follow if youâ€™re curious on future days and events! For instance, per the eventâ€™s page, today alone has the following happening: â€œ- Sugar Sand Festival hours 10 am â€“ 10 pm â€“ Souvenir Photo Hours: 10 am- 9:30 pm â€“ College Wall Art Master Sand Sculpting Competition â€“ Artisans and Street Performers â€“ Ferris Wheel and Inflatables â€“ FREE sand sculpting class 2 pm â€“ Tropico Sand Bar 3 pm by Hyatt Regency Clearwater Beach Resort and Spa â€“ Hooters Hangout Entertainment: 3-7 pm Brek Milo â€“ BayStar Restaurant Group VIP Lounge Experience: 5pm â€“ Frenchyâ€™s Free Beach Concerts: 7:30 pm Shawn Scheller & The Contendersâ€ Items Allowed: Blankets Low lying beach chairs Not Allowed: Pets â€“ only service animals are permitted on the sand. Pets however are permitted on the sidewalks, so long as they are on a leash. Grills, hibachis, or open flames of any kind. Glass containers or bottles Tents, canopies or umbrellas The Sugar Sand Festival is Rain or Shine This is a Rain or Shine event, as the sculptures are under a large tent. High winds are evidently the bigger threat to these sand sculptures and could close the festival at times. Accessibility: We have 2 complimentary sand wheelchairs and 2 motorized SandHelpers available at the Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival. They are available on a first come, first serve basis with a photo i.d. and signed waiver. There is a hard surface leading from the public sidewalk to the entrance of the Sugar Sand Walk Exhibit where the sand wheelchairs will be located. Thank you so much to Fun Ride Rentals for your partnership! For more information on additional beach wheelchair rentals, please contact Fun Ride Rentals for rates at (727) 519-3008 and Sand Helper at 727-213-5700 or https://www.sandhelper.com/ Parking: Parking: Per the event organizers, â€œif you arrive early in the day parking is plentiful in one of the three parking garages. If you are planning on attending later in the afternoon, may we suggest using the FREE Park and Ride from downtown Clearwater or the water taxi.â€ Please visit their website and social media accounts for additional details. Address: 1 Causeway Blvd, Clearwater, FL Google Reviews: 261 with a 4.8 average Hope everyone has a great weekend! I love our industry so much that I developed a vacation rental advertising business and ran it for a decade (before selling to HomeAway/VRBO). Iâ€™m a Florida native and St. Pete resident who is ready to earn your real estate business! Simply contact me. The Final Weekend of the Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Presented by Visit St. Pete/Clearwater Is Here The Final Weekend of the Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Presented by Visit St. Pete/Clearwater Is Here City of Clearwater, Florida sent this bulletin at 04/19/2023 03:43 PM EDT Having trouble viewing this email? View it as a Web page . The Final Weekend of the Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Presented by Visit St. Pete/Clearwater Is Here Enjoy Fireworks, Free Beach Concerts, the Ferris Wheel, a Classic Volkswagen Car Show, and More CLEARWATER, Fla. â€“ As the 2023 Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Presented by Visit St. Pete/Clearwater enters its final weekend, the excitement and entertainment continues. Along with the amazing Sugar Sand Art Exhibit featuring elaborate sand sculptures depicting, â€œA Blast From the Past: A Nostalgic Time Travel Back to the 50s, 60s, 70s, 80s and 90s,â€ the festival will host a wide variety of sandtastic events for the whole family this weekend, until the festival ends at 9 p.m. Sunday, April 23. This weekend is filled with live music, all part of the Frenchyâ€™s Free Beach Concerts series and the Hooters Hangout: Friday, April 21: Brek Milo (3 to 7 p.m.) and Tim Charron (7:30 p.m.) Saturday, April 22: Kyle Ingram (noon to 4 p.m.), Chris Flowers (4:30 to 7 p.m.), and T.L. Jentgens (7:30 p.m.) Sunday, April 23: DJ Ryan Moore and FIELDS (1:30 to 5:30 p.m.) and US Stones, a Rolling Stones tribute band (6 p.m.) Other fun activities include: Frontline Friday is April 21. All police, fire, military, teachers and healthcare workers will receive a discounted general admission ticket to the Sugar Sand Walk Exhibit for $10 with proper identification. Celebrate Earth Day with us at a family-friendly beach cleanup: Friday at 4 p.m. Free fireworks presented by Spectrum light up the night on Clearwater Beach this Saturday, April 22, at 9:30 p.m. Free sand-sculpting classes are on Friday at 2 p.m. and Saturday at 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. Take a drive down memory lane and check out amazing vintage rides at the Classic Volkswagen Car Show on Saturday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Clearwater Gas speed sand demonstrations happen Saturday and Sunday at 4 p.m. Ride the White Claw hard seltzer ferris wheel Friday and Saturday, 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. or Sunday, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. The BayStar VIP Lounge opens at 5 p.m. Friday to Sunday until close. The rest of the weekend will feature an interactive art installation, a kidâ€™s play zone, street-performers, artisans, Sunsets at Pier 60 daily festivals and more. Buy your tickets online to skip the line. General admission tickets are $14 and Baystar VIP Lounge tickets are $70, all available at SugarSandFestival.com . Children 3 years and younger are free. Tickets will stop being sold at 8:30 p.m. Sunday, April 24. The festival is cashless and contactless for patronsâ€™ safety. Accepted forms of payment include all major credit cards, Google Pay and Apple Pay. Festivalgoers should consider using the free PSTA Park & Ride trolley service to get to and from Clearwater Beach. Park downtown for free any day of the week, and hop on board the Jolley Trolley to get to and from the beach. For Park & Ride details, visit PSTA.net/SpringBreak . After the festival is over at 9 p.m. Sunday, April 24, the sand sculptures will be knocked down, and the sand will be returned to its original resting place. For tickets and event details, visit SugarSandFestival.com . If you have questions, send an email to Info@SugarSandFestival.com . About the Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival Fourteen world-class artists craft elaborate sand sculptures from Clearwaterâ€™s internationally famous sugar sand. The works of art are on display in a 21,000-square-foot structure. More than 1,000 tons of Clearwater sand takes on a new life, bringing visitors on a â€œsandtasticâ€ adventure. The festival is a joint effort between Sunsets at Pier 60 Daily Festival, a 501(c)3 organization and the city of Clearwater. Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival - SponsorMyEvent How it works Discover Events GET STARTED Login Home How it works for Sponsors How it works for Organizers Discover Events GET STARTED Login https://www.sponsormyevent.com/pier-60-sugar-sand-festival-clearwater Fri, Apr 07 - Sun, Apr 23 2023 Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival , Clearwater, Florida, United States Clearwater, Florida, United States 7 Sponsors Confirmed INFO AUDIENCE IMAGES 7 SPONSORS 7 About the event The #1 Sand Sculpting Festival in Florida! The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival stands out as one of the best sand sculpture festivals in Florida, with world-renowned sand artists entered to win the best in show with their crazy-cool sand creations.Â Head to Clearwater Beach and get your ticket to peruse the expansive 21,000-square foot structure, and gaze at the artists at work creating their amazing sand sculptures. With free live music, fireworks, and sand sculpting classes thereâ€™s more fun to have during the festival than grains of sand on Clearwater Beach. Why should you sponsor? The 2022 Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival had over 200,000 attendees over the 17-day event. Charissa Chandler The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival began in 2013. It is the largest event that takes place on Clearwater Beach. The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival is an annual event and fundraisorÂ for the Sunsets At Pier 60 Nightly Festival. Sunsets at Pier 60 debuted on March 17, 1995 as a year-round nightly sunset celebration on the iconic Pier 60. This 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization serves as a free, family-friendly destination for tourists and locals to experience. The purpose of Sunsets at Pier 60 is to promote Clearwater Beach and Pinellas County as a prime tourism destination. The festival strives to enhance the guest experience by encouraging longer stays while providing visitors and residents with additional evening entertainment options following their days spent enjoying the beach. For over 25 years, Sunsets at Pier 60 has provided the arts and busking community with a platform to showcase and express their authentic forms of art while encouraging the use of public lands for cultural and educational purposes. The year-round festival stimulates the economy by promoting Clearwater Beach and Pinellas County as a prime tourism destination, resulting in residual economic impact for the community. The nightly sunset celebration serves as a primary source of income for local and traveling artisans and professional entertainers. In addition to The Pier 60 Sugar Sand Festival,Â Sunsets at Pier 60 has produced numerous special events such as Beach Fest, Caribbean Christmas Art Show and FantaSea of Lights.
